content:
I realized, that I don't get any forum notification mails anymore... The sending server is currently on 5 blacklists. Commonly used ones, BTW, so probably hardly anyone gets these mails.

Blacklisted in:

  • BLOCKLIST.DE
  • IBM DNS Blacklist
  • RATS Spam (!)
  • SORBS SPAM
  • Spamhaus ZEN (!)

Servers that are on the Spamhaus dnsbl are extremely unlikely to get anywhere - that a widely used blacklist. Is there any chance to get rid of sendgrid? They're on dnsbl regularly.
I get Forum emails fine. I use FastMail...
The subdomains ideally need to be converted to cnames to encompass the DMARC policy unless forums truly is on a different IP, of which a dedicated dmarc policy will be needed, which might help.
@BWPanda can you look at the headers and see if spf, DKIM and DMARC are pass or fail on the forum emails?
Finally registered for forum.backdropcms.org. SPF, DKIM and DMARC all look good, so no worries there. Definitely an issue with blacklisted IPs :-(

The IP it was sent from is: 149.72.91.245 and checking that IP on blocklist.de passed. RATS spam passes everything except the "Spam" category.

Sendgrid "should" be sending out email on a variety of IP's, so are all of them really getting blocked?

Update: Some interesting info: https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/sending-email/deny-lists/

Looks like a dedicated IP or moving to a different email service would be some options. I've mentioned using Googles Workspace for Non-Profit for the internal backdrop email which would also allow it to be used as an SMTP relay. It's not my decision, so all I can do is recommend. I don't know what costs are involved with sendgrid, but the free Google Workspace for Non-Profit might reduce some costs in the short term until more advanced features are needed.
